title: EU Plans to Streamline Data, AI Rules in Bid to Boost Business
description: The European Union is preparing to streamline its privacy rulebooks in a bid to bolster the competitiveness of local technology and artificial intelligence companies, according to a package the bloc will unveil on Nov. 19.
content:

title: New guidance offered for responsible AI use in health care
description: Hundreds of health care artificial intelligence (AI) tools have been cleared by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), yet only a fraction are rigorously evaluated for clinical impact, fairness or bias. Furthermore, the FDA review only covers a small portion of health AI tools being developed and used in health care. The American Heart Association (Association), a global force changing the future of health for all, today released a new science advisory urging health systems to adopt clear and simple rules for using AI in patient care.

title: India's Strategic Leap in AI and Data Centers
description: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal chaired a meeting targeting the enhancement of ease of doing business in the data center and artificial intelligence sectors. The meeting emphasized fortifying policy frameworks and digital infrastructure to attract investments in future technologies, capitalizing on India's growing data center market.
content:

description: Financial technology has changed the way we think about money. In the past decade, it pushed for new ways to pay, bank and invest. title: Toronto region police unit turns to AI to help answer calls
description: The Halton Regional Police Service has launched an artificial intelligence call processing system designed to handle non-emergency phone calls.

title: AI revolution faces power challenges
description: SAN FRANCISCO — In the race for artificial intelligence (AI) dominance, American tech giants have the money and the chips, but their ambitions have hit a new obstacle: electric power.
